item.ptxt: Do not repair damaged SRS wiring. Replace the affected wiring harness(es).

Before doing any SRS repairs, check for DTCs with the HDS; refer to the appropriate Fit/Jazz Shop Manual for the less obvious deployed components (front seat belt tensioners, front impact sensors, side impact sensors, etc.).
When replacing the front seat belt tensioner, check the seat belt mounting portion for deformation. If any deformation is found, repair it as needed.
Inspect all the SRS wire harnesses. Replace, do not repair, any damaged harnesses.
Inspect the cable reel for heat damage. If there is any damage, replace the cable reel; refer to the appropriate Fit/Jazz Shop Manual.

trans.ptxt: After the vehicle is completely repaired, turn the vehicle to the ON mode. If the SRS indicator comes on for about seconds and then goes off, the SRS is OK. If the indicator does not function properly, use the HDS to check for the DTCs; refer to the appropriate Fit/Jazz Shop Manual. If you cannot retrieve a code, do the SRS Symptom Troubleshooting.
